intro: Urostachys bolivianus var. ringshausenii, commonly known as the Bolivian sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the dry regions of South America. It features a dense mat of silver-gray, fleshy leaves that are adapted to arid conditions. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers during the warmer months. It is well-suited for xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal. Its unique morphology makes it a valuable addition to rock gardens and arid landscape designs.
